heading: mucho bucks
subheading: if you can't beat 'em, join 'em. that seems to be the attitude of argentine president carlos menem, who has suggested that his country seriously consider ditching its national currency and adopting the us dollar instead. and the idea is receiving serious consideration at the highest levels in buenos aires. inspired perhaps by the advent of the euro, and cognizant of the fact that the argentine peso is not exactly a robust currency, menem sees the dollar as as a sheet anchor against the kind of ruinous inflation that crippled the country in the late 1980s. not everyone in argentina is thrilled by the idea -- there's a considerable amount of national pride at stake -- but economic stability is a potent lure. count on hearing a lot more about this.
author: wired staff
